verses.verse: Now when these things were done<WH3615>, the princes<WH8269> came<WH5066> to me, saying<WH559>, The people<WH5971> of Israel<WH3478>, and the priests<WH3548>, and the Levites<WH3881>, have not separated<WH914> themselves from the people<WH5971> of the lands<WH776>, doing according to their abominations<WH8441>, even of the Canaanites<WH3669>, the Hittites<WH2850>, the Perizzites<WH6522>, the Jebusites<WH2983>, the Ammonites<WH5984>, the Moabites<WH4125>, the Egyptians<WH4713>, and the Amorites<WH567>.

For they have taken<WH5375> of their daughters<WH1323> for themselves, and for their sons<WH1121>: so that the holy<WH6944> seed<WH2233> have mingled<WH6148> themselves with the people<WH5971> of those lands<WH776>: yea, the hand<WH3027> of the princes<WH8269> and rulers<WH5461> hath been chief<WH7223> in this trespass<WH4604>.

And when I heard<WH8085> this thing<WH1697>, I rent<WH7167> my garment<WH899> and my mantle<WH4598>, and plucked off<WH4803> the hair<WH8181> of my head<WH7218> and of my beard<WH2206>, and sat down<WH3427> astonied<WH8074>.

Then were assembled<WH622> unto me every one that trembled<WH2730> at the words<WH1697> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, because of the transgression<WH4604> of those that had been carried away<WH1473>; and I sat<WH3427> astonied<WH8074> until the evening<WH6153> sacrifice<WH4503>.

And at the evening<WH6153> sacrifice<WH4503> I arose up<WH6965> from my heaviness<WH8589>; and having rent<WH7167> my garment<WH899> and my mantle<WH4598>, I fell<WH3766> upon my knees<WH1290>, and spread out<WH6566> my hands<WH3709> unto the LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>, heaviness: or, affliction

And said<WH559>, O my God<WH430>, I am ashamed<WH954> and blush<WH3637> to lift up<WH7311> my face<WH6440> to thee, my God<WH430>: for our iniquities<WH5771> are increased<WH7235> over<WH4605> our head<WH7218>, and our trespass<WH819> is grown up<WH1431> unto the heavens<WH8064>. trespass: or, guiltiness

Since the days<WH3117> of our fathers<WH1> have we been in a great<WH1419> trespass<WH819> unto this day<WH3117>; and for our iniquities<WH5771> have we, our kings<WH4428>, and our priests<WH3548>, been delivered<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the kings<WH4428> of the lands<WH776>, to the sword<WH2719>, to captivity<WH7628>, and to a spoil<WH961>, and to confusion<WH1322> of face<WH6440>, as it is this day<WH3117>.

And now for a little<WH4592> space<WH7281> grace<WH8467> hath been shewed from the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430>, to leave<WH7604> us a remnant to escape<WH6413>, and to give<WH5414> us a nail<WH3489> in his holy<WH6944> place<WH4725>, that our God<WH430> may lighten<WH215> our eyes<WH5869>, and give<WH5414> us a little<WH4592> reviving<WH4241> in our bondage<WH5659>. space: Heb. moment a nail: or, a pin: that is, a constant and sure abode

For we were bondmen<WH5650>; yet our God<WH430> hath not forsaken<WH5800> us in our bondage<WH5659>, but hath extended<WH5186> mercy<WH2617> unto us in the sight<WH6440> of the kings<WH4428> of Persia<WH6539>, to give<WH5414> us a reviving<WH4241>, to set up<WH7311> the house<WH1004> of our God<WH430>, and to repair<WH5975> the desolations<WH2723> thereof, and to give<WH5414> us a wall<WH1447> in Judah<WH3063> and in Jerusalem<WH3389>. to repair: Heb. to set up
And now, O our God<WH430>, what shall we say<WH559> after<WH310> this? for we have forsaken<WH5800> thy commandments<WH4687>,

Which thou hast commanded<WH6680> by<WH3027> thy servants<WH5650> the prophets<WH5030>, saying<WH559>, The land<WH776>, unto which ye go<WH935> to possess<WH3423> it, is an unclean<WH5079> land<WH776> with the filthiness<WH5079> of the people<WH5971> of the lands<WH776>, with their abominations<WH8441>, which have filled<WH4390> it from one end<WH6310> to another<WH6310> with their uncleanness<WH2932>. by: Heb. by the hand of from: Heb. from mouth to mouth

Now therefore give<WH5414> not your daughters<WH1323> unto their sons<WH1121>, neither take<WH5375> their daughters<WH1323> unto your sons<WH1121>, nor seek<WH1875> their peace<WH7965> or their wealth<WH2896> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>: that ye may be strong<WH2388>, and eat<WH398> the good<WH2898> of the land<WH776>, and leave it for an inheritance<WH3423> to your children<WH1121> for ever<WH5769>.

And after<WH310> all that is come<WH935> upon us for our evil<WH7451> deeds<WH4639>, and for our great<WH1419> trespass<WH819>, seeing that thou our God<WH430> hast punished<WH2820> us less<WH4295> than our iniquities<WH5771> deserve, and hast given<WH5414> us such deliverance<WH6413> as this; hast punished: Heb. hast withheld beneath our iniquities

Should we again<WH7725> break<WH6565> thy commandments<WH4687>, and join in affinity<WH2859> with the people<WH5971> of these abominations<WH8441>? wouldest not thou be angry<WH599> with us till thou hadst consumed<WH3615> us, so that there should be no remnant<WH7611> nor escaping<WH6413>?

O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, thou art righteous<WH6662>: for we remain<WH7604> yet escaped<WH6413>, as it is this day<WH3117>: behold, we are before<WH6440> thee in our trespasses<WH819>: for we cannot stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> thee because of this.
